result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron Jeron Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Myron Jeron Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Myron Jeron Robinson was found guilty of Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).
  • Myron Jeron Robinson was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge during the period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Court ordered all costs, assessments, surcharges, DNA surcharge assessed in Count 3 to be paid during period of probation. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

Obtain/maintain employment as able.
Obtain GED or HSED.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
EACH COUNT: Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of the sentence, including financial, and sentence in 15CF4696, Court will allow for expungement. 973.015

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Court set restitution at $500.00 payable to Joshua H. to which defendant stipulated.

Concurrent with: concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 60 days time served.

Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge during the period of probation of Count 1.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Court found that further review is needed.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Cynthia Davis, Branch 21 in Room 504 of the Courthouse  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Refund Packets
Reinstated $500.00 Cash Bail for Restitution.

Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 49 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 21 MONTHS.  Conditions of probation include:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4/8/2016 at 1:15 pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment as able.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge during the period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Court ordered all costs, assessments, surcharges, DNA surcharge assessed in Count 3 to be paid during period of probation. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of the sentence, including financial, and sentence in 15CF4696, Court will allow for expungement. 973.015

As to Count 3:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 60 days time served.

-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge during the period of probation of Count 1.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 
-Court set restitution at $500.00 payable to Joshua H. to which defendant stipulated.
-COURT ORDERS CASH BAIL FORFEITED IN THE AMOUNT OF $500.00 TO BE REINSTATED AND APPLIED FOR RESTITUTION.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of the sentence, including financial, and sentence in 15CF4696, Court will allow for expungement. 973.015

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Myron Jeron Robinson not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Court adjourns matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson not in court.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Surety in Court. Bail argument made. Court DENIED Surety's request for return of bail (1,000.00). Bail remains forfeited.
LETTER FROM DEFENDANT'S MOTHER REQUESTING LESS JAIL TIME, RECEIVED AND FILED

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 5:
On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned in branch 38.

Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward. Myron Robinson appeared in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial.
AS TO COUNT 1:
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to injury by use of a dangerous weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.24(1), a Class I felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Ward was appointed late yesterday afternoon and has not received discovery yet. Atty Ward is available on the currently set dates.

Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Myron Jeron Robinson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defense moves to dismiss Use of a Dangerous Weapon in Count 3.  State does not object.  Court grants request.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense WITHHELD plea as to Counts 2, 3 and 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
